title: If bronzers spent less time on the forums spewing their nonsensical opinions..
body: and more time in a custom game learning how to cs, maybe they wouldn't be bronze.

replies.body:
Not everyone is motivated by the same things when it comes to playing games. I know a bunch of people that spend just as much (or more) time talking about the game than actually playing it, and they get a lot of satisfaction from that.

If you enjoy pushing it on up through Diamond, Masters, and Challenger, then that's awesome. You keep doing you. But let them do them, too.

It takes all types to make the world go round, as they say.

Another fact:

If everyone improved they wouldn't move out of bronze, the quality of bronze would just increase and therefore they would still be bronzers.  

Its kinda like water that is flavored, still water.

> [{quoted}](name=Zyorhist,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=REtUjJe1,comment-id=00070001,timestamp=2015-08-10T15:30:24.832+0000)
>
> Another fact:
> 
> If everyone improved they wouldn't move out of bronze, the quality of bronze would just increase and therefore they would still be bronzers.  
> 
> Its kinda like water that is flavored, still water.

Not exactly, because not everyone would improve at the same rate.
sure there would be up and down shifts but overall we are the bronze team for life.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=REtUjJe1,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2015-08-10T07:50:17.287+0000)
>
> Not everyone is motivated by the same things when it comes to playing games. I know a bunch of people that spend just as much (or more) time talking about the game than actually playing it, and they get a lot of satisfaction from that.
> 
> If you enjoy pushing it on up through Diamond, Masters, and Challenger, then that's awesome. You keep doing you. But let them do them, too.
> 
> It takes all types to make the world go round, as they say.

That'd be fine, but the point is that they don't have the mechanics nor knowledge, but that doesn't stop them from coming to the forum and shouting their opinions that "X Champion has no counterplay" and how "their shit teams are the reason they are bronze".

Actually, it is entirely possible to have a lot of game knowledge and still be bronze. Do I know how to play any champion perfectly? No. But that doesn't mean I can't know what makes Maokai so good against Riven, or why Vayne is strong this meta (not broken, but strong), or why some champions synergize with Devourer better than others.

You dont have to be chalenger to have an opinion or a voice. I hate elitist assholes like you. You were a noob once too. Also, just because you are gold doesnt mean your opinion is more valuable than anyone elses.

Also, even an average bronze player has more farm than you and your games, that i can state for a fact.

> [{quoted}](name=Dextix LT,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=REtUjJe1,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2015-08-10T08:37:55.649+0000)
>
> You dont have to be chalenger to have an opinion or a voice. I hate elitist assholes like you. You were a noob once too. Also, just because you are gold doesnt mean your opinion is more valuable than anyone elses.
> 
> Also, even an average bronze player has more farm than you and your games, that i can state for a fact.

to be fair, this guy plays mostly dominion, where you don't really cs at all

"gg ff at 20 team 2 heavy"

I'm unranked, but I can say I see this at least once in every 10 games.

I love when people say shit like that and they are losing lane or doing really stupid plays (I have to hit that one man {{champion:61}} ult to kill that SUPPORT!) Almost as much as when people say GG after failing a tower dive when they are 0/2 in lane.
10 games? i see that every game and i was in diamond.

Why play custom when they play with you and get carried?

Besides, Riot doesn't want people practicing in custom games, only in matchmaker games. Read their rational for Sandbox Mode never being a thing.
why do people feel the need to bash bronze players?

> [{quoted}](name=Commando Yi,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=REtUjJe1,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2015-08-10T14:09:04.335+0000)
>
> why do people feel the need to bash bronze players?

Same reason bullies pick on fat people at school. They generally feel inadequate, so they latch onto one thing they're "better at" than someone else and make as big a deal as possible out of it so that they can feel good. Angry Plat player spends hours every day insulting Bronze players so he can spend less time thinking about his failings in other, more important areas of life.

you know what bronzers are?

http://www.pagedaily.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/P185402_hero.jpg

> [{quoted}](name=VastoLordeh,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=REtUjJe1,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-08-10T01:24:19.823+0000)
>
> you know what bronzers are?
> 
> http://www.pagedaily.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/P185402_hero.jpg

It's what you need after grinding to 100 LP, and doing your promo matches just to move up a division in your league. Thanks Riot.

I try to make the argument that you don't necessarily need to have supreme game skill to talk about it if your knowledge is up to snuff.

Then I see people arguing for nidalee and mage buffs and I throw that logic out the window in favor of indiscriminate murder.
If we didn't have to dodge so much due to trolls, unskilleds, and afkers...we would be in more games than here.

> [{quoted}](name=imonly4noobcakes,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=REtUjJe1,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-08-10T00:40:29.455+0000)
>
> If we didn't have to dodge so much due to trolls, unskilleds, and afkers...we would be in more games than here.

Yeah, because Plat and Diamond players definitely don't deal with afkers, ragers, trolls, etc.

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Yamazuki,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=REtUjJe1,comment-id=00040001,timestamp=2015-08-10T01:17:49.689+0000)
>
> Yeah, because Plat and Diamond players definitely don't deal with afkers, ragers, trolls, etc.

Yet, had 7 promo games p2, 4 afk's, ^"

That said, downside of playing at night=afk fest

> [{quoted}](name=imonly4noobcakes,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=REtUjJe1,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-08-10T00:40:29.455+0000)
>
> If we didn't have to dodge so much due to trolls, unskilleds, and afkers...we would be in more games than here.

./yawn

> [{quoted}](name=imonly4noobcakes,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=REtUjJe1,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-08-10T00:40:29.455+0000)
>
> If we didn't have to dodge so much due to trolls, unskilleds, and afkers...we would be in more games than here.

In bronze you should honestly be able to 1v5 if you have a brain. Players are legit worse than bots.
It's comments like this that make everything else you say invalid.
Bronze 3. Literally incapable of losing lane to a bot.

Why dodge? Bronze is the best elo ever. No matter what you do, there is always a chance to come back bc people like to throw games, and you can win with literally anything! My normals MMR is still bronze level and I get to play shit like Mundo mid, Heimer ADC, whatever I want, and get reasonably fed. Hell I hit gold on this account and thought I should pull the account I leveled up w/ my brother out of bronze, and I played random shit for the first like 20 games and did just fine.

First game ever Maokai, not even played in bots? No problem, have fun, do most damage on the team (or second most and built tank so by far the most dmg absorbed). Decided I didn't want to play random stuff and played my main and had a 90% win rate for the first 20 games or so. Bronze is fucking wonderful. The promised land of play literally whatever the fuck you want. I hope I do terrible in promos and get placed in bronze for next season. Maybe if they do team builder for ranked next season I'll just que as ADC for every single one of my promo games. Of course I'd have to buy an adc champ if I was gonna do that, so maybe not worth it.
apparently all of them have a hidden high elo account because that's what they all claim.
But but, they know how to balance the champions. They know this game so well that they know which champs are op. Riven/vayne. It's their team holding them back duh
Don't downvote the OP for speaking the truth, if you blame your team for your ranking place, it's most likely your fault.
That may be true, but OP was making a gross overgeneralization to all bronze players.

> [{quoted}](name=TheFakeSit,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=REtUjJe1,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-08-10T00:02:33.184+0000)
>
> and more time in a custom game learning how to cs, maybe they wouldn't be bronze.

ok 3 pointers
1 Nobody is offended by bronzie/bronzer anymore
2 custom games are for alot of people a waste of time due to in most cases not earning any IP/LP during them.
3 Its not only cs keeping people in bronze, its a combination of that with lack of mechanics

> [{quoted}](name=warpenguin555,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=REtUjJe1,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2015-08-10T15:25:33.956+0000)
>
> ok 3 pointers
> 1 Nobody is offended by bronzie/bronzer anymore
> 2 custom games are for alot of people a waste of time due to in most cases not earning any IP/LP during them.
> 3 Its not only cs keeping people in bronze, its a combination of that with lack of mechanics

you most definitely can get out of bronze by learning to cs better. you don't even _really_ need mechanics to get out of silver.

> [{quoted}](name=Enosense,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=REtUjJe1,comment-id=000a0000,timestamp=2015-08-10T15:42:41.237+0000)
>
> you most definitely can get out of bronze by learning to cs better. you don't even _really_ need mechanics to get out of silver.

I'm in Bronze.  I jungle.  Please explain how CS is keeping me in Bronze.  Maybe, just maybe, it's because I placed in Bronze and almost exclusively play normals.  It has nothing to do with my CS.

It's funny, I checked your profile on carry.gg to see how well you farm.  When I play in lane, I usually average around 55-60% efficiency @5,10,15, and 20 minutes.  Surprise surprise, so do you.  Does that make me a plat IV capable bronzie?  Or does that make you a god-awful plat-iv?

http://www.carry.gg/na/TheFakeSit/match/1912498501

http://www.carry.gg/na/steampig/match/1914032974/4

> [{quoted}](name=steampig,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=REtUjJe1,comment-id=000a00000000,timestamp=2015-08-10T15:53:20.349+0000)
>
> I'm in Bronze.  I jungle.  Please explain how CS is keeping me in Bronze.  Maybe, just maybe, it's because I placed in Bronze and almost exclusively play normals.  It has nothing to do with my CS.

power farm when there are no contestable objectives/gank opportunities. someone in your lane dies? go farm their lane until they get back

i stepped into ranked solo queue for the first time this season after only playing normals. although i didn't place in bronze, i still climbed out of mid-silver without anything major in the way of mechanics (with jungle being my 3rd most played role) just by farming

> [{quoted}](name=Enosense,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=REtUjJe1,comment-id=000a000000000000,timestamp=2015-08-10T15:56:33.231+0000)
>
> power farm when there are no contestable objectives/gank opportunities. someone in your lane dies? go farm their lane until they get back
> 
> i stepped into ranked solo queue for the first time this season after only playing normals. although i didn't place in bronze, i still climbed out of mid-silver without anything major in the way of mechanics (with jungle being my 3rd most played role) just by farming

Yea, thanks, but I actually do that.  I end nearly every game I jungle with the highest CS out of both teams.  I don't even make it a point to farm a lane when my laner dies, I only do it if the tower needs protecting or the enemy laner is hanging out free farming and there is nothing else pressing on my plate.  Otherwise I'll go put some pressure elsewhere.
